author: Bloomberg.com
title: Haitong Securities to Buy Back $3.48 Billion of Stock Amid Rout
text:
Haitong Securities Co. will buy back up to 21.6 billion yuan ($3.48 billion) of its Shanghai-listed and Hong Kong-listed shares, as China scrambles to control its biggest stock market plunge since 1992.
The Shanghai-based brokerage will repurchase A shares for as much as 18.8 yuan apiece, according a statement to the Shanghai exchange Wednesday. The company will spend as much as HK$17.18 apiece on its H shares, the statement said.
The buyback comes as the Chinese government rolls out a series of steps to stabilize a weeks-long stock market rout. On Wednesday, the China Securities Regulatory Commission banned major shareholders, corporate executives and directors from selling stakes in listed companies for six months. Caijing magazine reported on its website the same day that the regulator is asking holders who sold more than 500 million yuan of stock to buy back shares.
